org.apache.edgent.streamscope.mbeans

Interface StreamScopeMXBean

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    StreamScopeBean

    public interface StreamScopeMXBean
    A Stream "oscilloscope" for capturing stream tuples for analysis / debug.
    See Also:
    StreamScopeRegistryMXBean

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String TYPE
      TYPE is used to identify this bean as a StreamScope bean when building the bean's ObjectName.

    • Field Detail

      • TYPE

        static final java.lang.String TYPE
        TYPE is used to identify this bean as a StreamScope bean when building the bean's ObjectName. The value is "streamScope"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Is tuple capture enabled?
        Returns:
        true if enabled.

      • setEnabled

        void setEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
        Enable or disable tuple capture.

        Disabling releases the capture buffer.

        Parameters:
        isEnabled - true to enable, false to disable.
        See Also:
        setPaused(boolean)

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()
        Is capture paused?
        Returns:
        true if paused

      • setPaused

        void setPaused(boolean paused)
        Set capture paused control

        Pausing doesn't affect the capture buffer's current contents.

        Parameters:
        paused - true to pause, false to clear pause.

      • getSamples

        java.lang.String getSamples()
        Get all captured tuples as JSON.

        The JSON is that generated by Gson.toJson(StreamScope.getSamples()).

        The JSON is an array of Sample JSON objects. Each Sample JSON object consists of:

        • ts - long. capture timestamp in millis from System.currentTimeMillis()
        • nanos - long. capture nanosecond timestamp from System.nanoTime()
        • tuple - see below
        The value of the "tuple" property is:
        • for a primitive tuple type like String, Numeric or Boolean it's a JSON string, numeric, or boolean value respectively.
        • Arrays or collections are a JSON array of JSON elements for the members.
        • For other types it's a JSON object with the type's members and JSON encoding of their values.

        The returned samples are removed from the capture buffer.

        Returns:
        JSON of the captured samples

      • getSampleCount

        int getSampleCount()
        Get the number of Samples currently captured
        Returns:
        the count

      • setMaxRetentionCount

        void setMaxRetentionCount(int maxCount)
        Set the maximum number of tuples to retain.

        The capture buffer is cleared.

        Parameters:
        maxCount - the maximum number of tuples to retain. Specify 0 to disable count based retention.

      • setMaxRetentionTime

        void setMaxRetentionTime(long age,
                         java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Set the maximum retention time of a tuple.

        The capture buffer is cleared.

        Parameters:
        age - the amount of time to retain a tuple. Specify 0 to disable age based retention.
        unit - TimeUnit

      • setCaptureByCount

        void setCaptureByCount(int count)
        Capture the first and every nth tuple
        Parameters:
        count - the nth value interval

      • setCaptureByTime

        void setCaptureByTime(long elapsed,
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Capture the 1st tuple and then the next tuple after period unit time has elapsed since the previous captured tuple.
        Parameters:
        elapsed - time to delay until next capture
        unit - TimeUnit
